definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Sliding door variation and then a same foot lunge.
sentences.chinese: 滑门变化步，接着来一个同足剑步下腰。

sentences.english: I think they come out of sliding doors.
sentences.chinese: 我猜那些应该是滑门的某个部份。

sentences.english: Rearward-sliding door aft of main landing gear on port side, with steps below.
sentences.chinese: 向后滑门对主起落架左舷船尾，操作步骤如下。

sentences.english: There are sliding doors between rooms.
Përshkrimi: Sliding door variation and then a same foot lunge.
sentences.chinese: 滑门变化步，接着来一个同足剑步下腰。

definition: an overhung door/a door that hinges upwards
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
